primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the world in disguise (the 'Stealth Bomber') to wage war against the cosmic powers of Sin and Death through the shame and suffering of the Cross, achieving a victory that is invisible to worldly standards.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the Father and Son in the power of the Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God chose what is foolish in the world to shame the wise
The Father and the Son together... have completed the work of salvation
He has come in under the radar

object.identificatie: The overcoming of sin and the consummation of love/salvation

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Plan of God
tekstueel_bewijs: according to the plan and purpose of God from the beginning

ontvanger.identificatie: The human race and the whole of God's creation
tekstueel_bewijs: what our God accomplished for us
the future of the human race
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary who is currently in 'darkness'.

helper.identificatie: The Biblical Witnesses (Apostles, Prophets, Paul, John)
tekstueel_bewijs: the witnesses who tell us the story of Jesus
built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the witnesses are the Helpers who make the Subject's action known.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the power in which the work is completed.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Evil, Satan, Death, and 'The World' (worldly standards of power)
tekstueel_bewijs: a war against sin, a war against evil, a war against Satan, a war against death
the world, the flesh and the Devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are not mere moral failings but ontological and cosmic powers that require a 'divine drama' and the death of the King to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community of believers reaffirming trust in the witness and standing together in the darkness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Worshipping Community ('You and I')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action of 'trusting' is a response to the completed 'strange work' of God.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Apostolic Witness → God in Christ ← Sin/Death/Satan

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Father and the Son... have completed the work
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We should be careful about subscribing
I have learned that he can be trusted

voorbeelden: The New Testament writers want us to focus
it is important that we know where to put the emphasis
unveiling as it does the very nature of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God exercised in the 'Weakness' of the Cross. It is not about what the hearer must do, but what God was able to do through the 'Stealth' of the Incarnation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the false power of the world (~S1) to the apparent defeat of the grave (S2), then reveals that S2 is actually the location of S1 (The Crucified God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'Paradox'—God's power is hidden in its opposite (sub contraria specie).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death and abandonment are treated as real, not illusions.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; the human condition is described as one of 'shame' and 'abandonment' that only a divine 'Stealth' intervention can solve.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I have learned that he can be trusted.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Father and the Son together... have completed the work of salvation.
a war against sin, a war against evil, a war against Satan, a war against death.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul, Isaiah) are used as witnesses to the event, not as moral models for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul is a witness to the power that saved him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance in the face of suffering and abandonment.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic; God does the work while man is in 'darkness'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of the Stealth Bomber perfectly integrates the hiddenness of God's power with the reality of the Cross.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Internet' community and 'Actual' community is a minor secondary track.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The love that goes to war... a war against Satan, a war against death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the power through which the work is completed and the 'marks' are borne.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a power to be warred against, not just a mistake to be corrected.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's 'strange work'. The hearer is positioned as the one in the dark for whom the war is won.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a Good Friday meditation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids all moralistic traps by keeping the 'active verbs' firmly in God's hands.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Stealth Bomber' metaphor's effectiveness; Greimas shows that this metaphor functions as a 'Modal Competence' (hidden power).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 1 Corinthians; Greimas shows how the sermon's structure mirrors Paul's logic of 'God choosing' (Subject) vs 'The World' (Opponent).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'shame' of the cross is not just a theme but a 'disguise' actantially necessary to bypass the 'radar' of the Opponent.

volledige_object_lijst: The future of the human race
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's own 'Grammar of Grace' perfectly.
